description: The CompTIA Project+ show is for business professionals who need to assist in coordinating projects or manage small projects. It is not specifically geared toward the IT field but projects in general. A viewer of the show in addition to persona study will gain knowledge and skills required to assist in planning and managing a small-to-medium-size project. He or she will understand the project life cycle, learn steps to ensure appropriate communication, manage resources and stakeholders, and learn techniques to maintain project documentation used to support the completion of projects. The show helps prepare CompTIA Project+ candidates with least 12 months of total experience in leading, managing, directing, and/or participating in small-to-medium-size projects for examination.

He or she will understand the project life cycle, learn steps to ensure appropriate communication, manage resources and stakeholders, and learn techniques to maintain project documentation used to support the completion of projects. The show helps prepare CompTIA Project+ candidates with least 12 months of total experience in leading, managing, directing, and/or participating in small-to-medium-size projects for examination.  __This course has been CAQC'd and qualifies for CEU credits. [Click here](https://itpro.tv/comptia-partnership) to get an exam voucher discount.__
name: CompTIA Project+ (2016)
subtitle: Project Management

episodes.description: The CompTIA Project+ show is for business professionals who need to assist in coordinating projects or manage small projects. It is not specifically geared toward the IT field but projects in general. A viewer of the show in addition to persona study will gain knowledge and skills required to assist in planning and managing a small-to-medium-size project. He or she will understand the project life cycle, learn steps to ensure appropriate communication, manage resources and stakeholders, and learn techniques to maintain project documentation used to support the completion of projects. The show helps prepare CompTIA Project+ candidates with least 12 months of total experience in leading, managing, directing, and/or participating in small-to-medium-size projects for examination.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode Cherokee and Ronnie explain the differences between the two exams.
episodes.title: Comparing PK0-003 vs PK0-004

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee cover project properties and help explain the differences between a project and a program. Ronnie defines Projects as a temporary endeavor to create a unique product, service or result whereas programs refers to an ongoing effort that is repetitive and follows existing procedures. They also discuss  what a project as part of a portfolio is and how it can be beneficial. Whether it be categorizing a landscaping service to developing a java program for a website make sure you feel comfortable understanding and identifying  the differences of a project versus program.
episodes.title: Explain Project Properties

episodes.description: In this episode you will find Cherokee and Ronnie diving into the many Roles and Responsibilities covered on CompTIA's Project+ exam. You will see the roles of Sponsor and Champion and even learn how certain roles be combined depending on the size of the organization or Project team. Other Roles covered here include Project Managers and Stakeholders. Understanding the essential roles and responsibilities of each title will be an integral part of defying a well organized Project team.
episodes.title: Understand Roles and Responsibilities

episodes.description: Ronnie and Cherokee continue to cover the individual responsibilities of each Role within a Project. In this episode you will understand what a Project Coordinator does and how that differs from previously covered roles such as Sponsor and Champion. You will also, look at the tasks which define a Scheduler, the Project Team and even a PMO (Project Management Office).
episodes.title: Understand Roles and Responsibilities Part 2

episodes.description: Having methodic approach to a project will provide a plethora of benefits. A haphazard approach may overlook details and leave many gaps as well as cause waste. Ronnie and Cherokee cover the Standard Project Phases in a detailed fashion. First, they look at the Initiation phase. In this phase you determine activities that lead to the Project's authorization. You will also learn about many tools to assist you thru this phase. The tools include a project charter, business case, high-level scope as well as identifying high-level risks.
episodes.title: Distinguish Standard Project Phases Part 1

episodes.description: This episode sheds light on the second project phase, Planning. Here you will see the value of creating a schedule, capitalizing on your resources as well as using many tools to help get achieve a successful plan. Ronnie shows an example of  a Work Breakdown Structure in addition to highlighting the importance of the Project Manager in this phase.
episodes.title: Distinguish Standard Project Phases Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee discuss the Execution and Monitoring phases and explain how they may be occurring in tandem. Ronnie encourages resource identification, including utilizing helpful tools. Your project plan may even be the most beneficial tool in addition to some other useful activities such as: Team Development, Quality Assurance, Established Communications, Schedule Variances as well as Project Plan Updates.
episodes.title: Distinguish Standard Project Phases Part 3

episodes.description: This episode Ronnie and Cherokee look at the last 2 phases of a project. Ronnie explains what is involved in the finality of a project. Will the project be concluded or rejected? Tune in to find out! But wait! There is more... in addition to the optional training implemented in the closing phase CompTIA specifically defines one final phase for training. Once activities such as: The project sign off, archiving, debriefing, releasing resources, and all contracts are closed we can finally call it a day and move on to the next project.
episodes.title: Distinguish Standard Project Phases Part 4

episodes.description: Perplexed when managing a project budget? Then look no further! Ronnie and Cherokee look at some great ways to help your project budget stay on track. We learn the difference between your actual versus planned budget and how that  can really be beneficial. Ronnie also encourages us to account for all payments and expenses via total project cost calculations. We also learn how to prevent premature budget exhaustion with tools such as expenditure tracking and reporting as well as burn rate calculations.
episodes.title: Identify Cost Control Basics

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee hash out the differences between the different team organizational structures and the associated authority of Project Manager per structure . Here we look at the the functional, matrix and projected methods specifically. Check out the show notes for a great graph to review.
episodes.title: Identify Team Organization Structures

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee dissect a work breakdown structure in addition to covering the purposes and benefits to having one. They convey the importance to decomposition, or breaking down the scope into workable components to help estimate duration, allocate resources and assign costs. We create different levels of our WBS during decomposition. We see the top level as the project, the 2nd sub level as work units and lower levels being called work package levels. Ronnie also shows us an example of a WBS dictionary to help us understand how to decipher a WBS without having to rely on interpretations of the document.
episodes.title: Execute and Develop a Project Schedule

episodes.description: During this episode Ronnie and Cherokee continue to explain how to develop and execute a project schedule. You learn how schedule activities and determine task details. Ronnie shows an example of PMIS (Project Management Information Software) with Microsoft Project and how it pertains to predecessors and dependencies.
episodes.title: Execute and Develop a Project Schedule Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode you will take a close look at three types of task dependencies in addition to sequencing and prioritizing tasks. Ronnie demonstrates how to manually calculate and determine the critical path. Lastly, we see the difference between quality and governance gates.
episodes.title: Execute and Develop a Project Schedule Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee explain Agile Methodology Basics. We learn the importance of swiftly evolving to changing needs. We look at the Iterative approach and see the defacto of a two week sprint creating workable smaller goals. We also look at Sprint planning.
episodes.title: Identify Agile Methodology Basics

episodes.description: This episode kicks off with a Definition and diagram of SCRUM Meetings to help you see the usefulness of these brief, daily ,standup meetings. Remember SCRUM meetings should have each team member  gives a status update that should include what they have done, what they plan to do next, and address any issues they are facing. We also see how to utilize burndown charts to help keep the project on a steady course. Lastly, SCRUM retrospective is defined as reviewing how well the team works together.
episodes.title: Identify Agile Methodology Basics Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Cherokee and Ronnie talk about Resource management. First Ronnie delineates between Human, Equipment and Material resources. Next we learn how to identify shared or dedicated resources. Ronnie shows some tools to help us prevent resource shortage and over-allocation to prevent utilizing benched resources.
episodes.title: Explain Resource Management Roles

episodes.description: Forming, storming, norming performing and adjourning oh my! No, we are not rapping or writing poetry. We are talking about personnel management and ways to find solutions to conflicts that may arise. Ronnie and Cherokee also discuss formal and informal team building activities. The topic of team selection is addressed and carried over to the next episode.
episodes.title: Explain Resource Management Roles Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee address identifying skill sets and weigh in on training and how it can benefit the project. They also, warn on  the possibility of communication obstacles that may emerge.
episodes.title: Explain Resource Management Roles Part 3

episodes.description: This episode is all about conflict resolution. Ronnie and Cherokee remark on several viable options to possibly help avoid a termination. However, they do acknowledge the fact that sometimes it is necessary and cover what to do in that situation .
episodes.title: Explain Resource Management Roles Part 4

episodes.description: This episode is chock full of risk strategies and actives. Ronnie and Cherokee look at some risk responses and when they would be acceptable. We also look at tools to help identify and analyze risk. By prioritizing we are then able to focus our efforts.
episodes.title: Predict Impact of Constraints and Influences

episodes.description: This episode is a continuation. Ronnie and Cherokee pick up examining the impact of project constraints and influences. You will learn the importance of monitoring elements such as cost, scope and scheduling to see how they can reduce the probability of exceeding limitations and help keep the project on track.
episodes.title: Predict Impact of Contraints and Influences Part 2

episodes.description: This episode is chock full of risk strategies and actives. Ronnie and Cherokee look at some risk responses and when they would be acceptable. We also look at tools to help identify and analyze risk. By prioritizing we are then able to focus our efforts.
episodes.title: Explain Risk Strategies and Activities

episodes.description: With so many possible communication methods it can sometimes be difficult to decide which method to choose. Ronnie and Cherokee examine the options and suggest where they would be best suited. From faxes to social media we have got you covered!
episodes.title: Use Appropriate Communication Methods

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee analyze factors that may impact communication. Weather it be language barriers or times zones it is important to identify these factors as well as any effects they may have on your project.
episodes.title: Analyze Communication Factors

episodes.description: Communication triggers are indicators or events that a risk may or has occurred. In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee discuss a dozen different types of  communication triggers you should be aware of to help offer some foresight. You will learn how to detect these triggers to help mitigate  negative responses.
episodes.title: Explain Communication Triggers

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee discuss change control processes. They identify numerous types of project changes that may occur from timeline changes to scope changes. We also learn how we should formally approach these changes.We examine the importance of Identification, documentation, impact evaluating and how to properly coordinate the appropriate course of action with our stakeholders.
episodes.title: Use Change Control Process

episodes.description: This episode is a continuation of the change control process. Ronnie and Cherokee take an in depth look at regression planning. We learn the necessary steps and tools to implement to ensure we have a successful "plan b".
episodes.title: Use Change Control Process Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee explain the different types of organizational changes companies may face. Certain scenarios warrant different approaches and it is best to always have a well thought out way of executing these changes.From acquisitions to divestitures it is crucial to methodically approach these changes to avoid numerous problems not limited to things like logistical oversights to loss of morale.
episodes.title: Recognize Types of Organizational Changes

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee begin to discuss the numerous project management tools available. Ronnie shows examples of a Gantt, Fishbone, Pareto and Run charts. By utilizing charts such as these one is able to present raw data in an easily understandable and presentable visual representation.
episodes.title: Compare Project Management Tools

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie explains SWOT analysis. He gives s brief history and describes the four universal areas compared to the original six. You will also see the Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed (RACI) Matrix.
episodes.title: Compare Project Management Tools Part 2

episodes.description: This episode Ronnie and Cherokee bring you into the 20th Century by describing technological tools such as Intranet versus Internet sites, Wiki pages, vendor knowledge bases and collaboration platforms to improve your projects. You will also be introduced to the terms you will use in the next episode to perform calculations.
episodes.title: Compare Project Management Tools Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee analyze project centric documentation. We see the importance of a Project Charter and various other helpful documents as well. By keeping a detailed account of your project and staying organized is really what is going to you manage your project.
episodes.title: Analyze Project Documentation

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee Identify common partner or vendor-centric documents. You will see specific documents and learn how to leverage them properly. We see documents such as formal requests, non disclosure agreements (NDA's), statement of work (SOW) contacts, memorandum of understanding agreements (MOW's) and Service Level Agreements (SLA's).
episodes.title: Identify Third Party Documents
